questions.text: A patient was using one of the anti-glaucoma drugs and observed Black deposits on the conjunctiva. The suspected drug known to cause this adverse effect is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Adrenergic agonists Alpha-2-adrenergic agonists like apraclonidine and brimonidine are used in the treatment of glaucoma. Adrenergic agonists like adrenaline form adrenochrome in the conjunctiva and are responsible for Black deposits in the conjunctiva It penetrates the cornea and is hydrolyzed by the esterases present there into Adrenaline, which itself has poor corneal penetration and causes ocular smarting and reactive hyperemia. They reduce aqueous humor production

questions.text: Which of the following is false about Brimonidine?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Does not cross BBB Brimonidine is α2 selective and more lipophilic than Apraclonidine, So it Crosses BBB and causes CNS depression Action: Reduces aqueous production Brimonidine is indicated both for short-term (prophylaxis of i.o.t. spikes post laser/post-surgery) as well as long-term use in glaucoma. It is generally used for add-on therapy only. Brimonidine is contraindicated in children <2yrs. It causes brain suppression which leads to apnea.

questions.text: Which of the following acts by decreasing aqueous humor?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Betaxolol Betaxolol acts on beta receptors and decreases aqueous humor formation It has the advantage of less bronchopulmonary and probably fewer cardiac, central, and metabolic side effects. Betaxolol is a beta 1 or cardioselective or 2nd generation beta blocker.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Other drugs act by increasing uveoscleral outflow, possibly by increasing the permeability of tissues in ciliary muscle or by an action on episcleral vessels.

questions.text: Iris pigmentation is noted with the use of one of the following drugs used in glaucoma:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Prostaglandin analogs Prostaglandin analogs cause iris pigmentation, growth of eyelashes, and macular edema Because of good efficacy, once-daily application, and absence of systemic complications, PG analogs have become the first-choice drugs for open-angle glaucoma They act by increasing uveoscleral outflow

Extraedge:

PROSTAGLANDIN ANALOGUES Prostaglandin E1: · Misoprostol (oral, Intravaginal) · Gemeprostol Alprostadil (IV, Intraurethral, Intracavernosal route) Prostagladin 12 Epoprostenol (IV) Prostaglandin F2 a: · Latanoprost (Opthalmic) · Carboprost (IM) Prostaglandin E2: Dinoprostone (Intravaginal)

questions.text: Which of the following drugs can be used in the treatment of hypotrichosis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Bimatoprost Prostaglandin analogs have side effects of heterochromia iridis, hypertrichosis, and macular edema. The side effect of hypertrichosis is clinically utilized in patients having hypotrichosis. Prostaglandin analogs cause the growth of eyelashes so can be used in hypotrichosis. Bimatoprost is a synthetic prostamide derivative found to be equally or more effective than latanoprost in lowering i.o.t. No systemic side effects are reported.

Extraedge:

questions.text: A Male with insulin-dependent diabetes having macular edema develops glaucoma. Which drug should be used as the last resort to treat?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Prostaglandin analog As the patient already has macular edema, so prostaglandin analogs like latanoprost and bimatoprost can’t be used. Prostaglandin analogs cause Iris pigmentation, growth of eyelashes, and macular edema Macular edema can develop during treatment with any PGF2α analog, especially in aphakic patients A watch should be kept to detect it early.

questions.text: Orbital fat atrophy is caused by:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Latanoprost

Highyeild:

PG analog adverse effects include allergic conjunctival hyperemia, increases permanent iris pigmentation, orbital fat atrophy, and macular edema Latanoprost is instilled in the eye and the effect is well sustained over the long term. Macular edema can develop during treatment with any PGF2α analog, especially in aphakic patients ; a watch should be kept to detect it early.

Extraedge:

Mechanism of action Mixed pharmacological responses 4 types- EP, FP, IP and TP Two mechanisms Relaxation of ciliary muscle and increase in uveoscleral outflow Remodelling of trabecular meshwork extracellular matrix

questions.text: Which of the following antiglaucoma medications can cause drowsiness?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Brimonidine

Highyeild:

The incidence of drowsiness with brimonidine is 4-29 %. It is the prodrug of clonidine. Alpha-adrenergic agents reduce the production of aqueous humor. Examples include apraclonidine and brimonidine Only Brimonidine crosses BBB and can cause drowsiness Brimonidine causes brain suppression which can also lead to apnea. Brimonidine is contraindicated in children <2yrs of age.

Extraedge:

Brimonidine is used in the treatment of ocular hypertension (pressure in the eye) and glaucoma. It helps to lower high pressure in the eye and reduces the risk of vision loss. This medicine may be used alone or in combination with another eye drop that reduces pressure in the eye.
